info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 7:57AM CDT until April 22 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS St Louis MO
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri...
Maries River near Westphalia.
Moreau River near Jefferson City.
River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Maries River near Westphalia.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to Tuesday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 13.9 feet, County Road 615 just north of the U.S. Highway 63 bridge begins flooding at this height.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 6.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this afternoon to 12.0 feet this evening. It will then fall just after midnight tonight. It will rise to 13.8 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/lsx

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TUESDAY AFTERNOON
